creator: AbhishekGhosh
title: Arduino Door Bell With VU Meter
description: This project demonstrates a basic Arduino-based doorbell with a VU meter. When the push button is pressed, LEDs will rhythmically glow along with a buzzer sound, and then both events will automatically stop after a set time.
steps: Gather the required hardware components: Arduino UNO, breadboard, jumper wires, pushbutton switch, 1k ohm resistor, 221 ohm resistors, and a piezo buzzer.
Build the circuit according to the provided schematic diagram (or Fritzing file).
Compile the provided code and upload it to the Arduino. Note that the code requires two tabs in the Arduino IDE: the main code and the 'pitches.h' file.
Consider improvements to the project such as increasing the number of LEDs, using a more powerful buzzer or an MP3 shield for sound, and adding automation features.
